results.title: Sub-Igloo [French version]
results.creator_credit: James de B. Domville, Joseph MacInnis, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Film report from a Canadian scientific expedition that put a plastic bubble on the floor of the Arctic Ocean to serve as workshop and rest station for scientists working below the Arctic ice. What it took, in both planning and on-the-spot improvisation, to chop through the heavy ice, and to lower and anchor the huge dome in place in the dark and cold of Resolute Bay, is fully illustrated by film and commentary. French language - no subtitles. (Award: Bordeaux.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: James de B. Domville, Joseph MacInnis, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Style wars
results.creator_credit: Tony Silver, Henry Chalfant and Public Art Films
results.brief_description: Examines New York’s “hiphop” subculture - the cradle of graffiti, breakdancing and rap music movements which have rocked the international worlds of art and entertainment. Cleverly juxtaposes the viewpoints of the graffiti writers, with those of law enforcement officers and government officials. Mayor Koch advocates five days in jail for repeat “graffiti” offenders and it would appear that there doesn’t seem to be much attempt by those working for the system to understand this sub-culture.

results.title: Sudden departure
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When an infant or small child enters hospital, there can be dangerous emotional shock caused by separation from the mother. Filmed at a children’s hospital, this film examines the nature of the child’s deprivation. A psychiatrist discusses what parents can do to lessen fear and anxiety. (Awards: Cairo; La Plata.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Georges Dufaux, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Successful sound for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: To create a successful video story it is essential that the correct type of sound is used for each shot. This video describes the situations in which both sync sound and non-sync sound should be used. It also discusses the issues surrounding different types of microphones (handheld, gun, personal), Mono and stereo soundtracks, recording non-sync sound (tape recorders, video camera recorder, commercial sound effects recordings), sound levels and distortion (under- and over-modulation) and mixing sounds using equalisers to control relative volumes, tone and the positioning of sound.

results.title: Successful lighting for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: This video emphasises the importance of lighting in successfully portraying the subject of a shot in a video. The areas covered include: contrast; quality; intensity; direction and colour.

results.title: Successful editing for video
results.creator_credit: Chris Wonsky, Mik Parsons and ViT
results.brief_description: Editors needs to follow the rules of how people percieve what they are watching - a logical sequence of events - so that the story being told makes sense. Successful editing can enhance the power with which a story can be told by establishing the scene of the story, creating visual interest, following the dramatic focus, controlling timing and emphasis and selecting the best material. This video describes the factors which should be taken into consideration when editing a video sequence.
results.description: Editors needs to follow the rules of how people percieve what they are watching - a logical sequence of events - so that the story being told makes sense. This video describes the factors which should be taken into consideration when editing a video sequence.
